actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase to $24,000 in 1981 (with automatic adjustments thereafter) the amount of outside earnings which a beneficiary age sixty-five or over may have in any taxable year without suffering reductions in the amount of his benefits.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to increase to $24,000 in 1981 the amount of outside earnings which a beneficiary age 65 or over may have without a reduction of benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase to $24,000 in 1981 (with automatic adjustments thereafter) the amount of outside earnings which a beneficiary age sixty-five or over may have in any taxable year without suffering reductions in the amount of his benefits.
